title: Certain functions have stopped working in firefox
content: I have recently encountered problems on a couple of websites involving updating account data and ordering. I had trouble signing in to one account and then updating that account - the webpage just wouldn't respond. In another case I was trying to complete an order and again it just wouldn't work. My solution in both cases was to switch to Chrome where everything worked normally. So, is Firefox incompatible with some process that webpages use for account managment and ordering?
creator: ScottishTerrier

title: New Tab Missing Shortcuts
content: The recent update is preventing my shortcuts and recently selected sites. The settings are correct, see attached. What other troubleshooting steps can we take?

title: difficoltà intermittenti nella ricerca su browser con Google
content: Talvolta, anzi spesso, non riesco, quando la scheda è aperta , a cercare normalmente e velocemnte una voce sulla barra Google, né in quella principale né in quella piccola in alto a destra: apro altre schede o finestre e stesso risultato, finchè, pare quasi per caso, poi si apre all'improvviso: noto che il tasto virtuale "ricarica la pagina corrente" diventa quasi intermittente e l'attesa sembra infinita. Con MFirefox mi sono sempre trovato ben, prima degli aggiornamenti (che eseguo sempre) non mi era mai accadutp: ora spesso devo usare altri browsers quando ho fretta. Ho provato a mettere qualche impostazione consigliata, ma nulla da fare. Potete aiutarmi? Grazie
creator: babinfrancesco

title: Tabs addon
content: Is there a way to back up the tabs I have open? I tried a tab manager, I've forgotten it's name, a few years ago and it worked for a while then the folders I had started to come up empty. I e-mailed the owner but got no response and no help getting the lost tabs back. I am looking at Tree Style Tab but any other suggestions are welcome.

title: Infiltration by Chinese advertising
content:
Technitians recently installed SKYPE and OUTLOOK so that I could communicate with fellow musicians in UK. I use Kaspersky for protection. I live in the mountains here in Spain. I am getting old and get very little support here. 2 years I got attacks by hackers. I am scared because after Outlook was installed unwanted ONLINE CHINESE ADVERSISERS appeared on my taskbar. We have two working computers and we depend on them for a lot of things. Please can you help? I am very worried and upset.

I will be very grateful for your attention, help and support. Thank you. JD.
creator: jenniferdavies2012

title: firefox says mic is enabled but it won't work
content:
Hi,

My mic will not connect to anything with firefox. when on the individual web pages it says mic is allowed but the websites won't detect any microphone. i've tested this with discord and a handful of voice/pitch training websites, the results are always the same. it says the mic is allowed but the website won't pick it up

i've tried clearing my cache and the other recommendations i could find online like allowing autoplay, it still isn't working. i am on a mac using an external microphone and i've already made sure firefox has all mic permissions and that the mic works by testing it in the apple mic test thing as well as with other applications. this problem only comes up with firefox. i also disabled any privacy/security addons (i have ghostery, privacy badger and ublock origin, all currently disabled)

this is very frustrating and i truely don't know what to do about it, any advice would be greatly appricated

creator: cfbell2020

title: firefox uses way too much CPU and hard drive
content:
I have been using firefox for many years but recently I ran into this issue which has forced me to switch to chrome. I often stream a video in one window while working in another. The other window has several tabs (email, news, ebay, amazon). Often when I switch from one tab to another, there is a 30-second delay while my hard drive activity goes up and the streaming video freezes. Sometimes it even cuts out and I have to reload it. I loaded system manager and it shows firefox using all the hard drive and/or cpu cycles. I switched to chrome and the problem went away. I have an Intel I7 cpu with an SSD and 16g of ram.

separate issue on another machine: On my work computer I dont stream video so I don't have this issue. However, I got notification about a month ago that there is a new version of firefox. Despite downloading and installing it 3 times, that notification still pops up several times a day.

title: render artefacts in firefox
content:
Hi All,

Few months ago I switched to an AMD Ryzen 9 7950x3D and since then I've been having rendering issues in firefox just as you can see in the attached image. Disabling hardware GPU acceleration seems to mitigate the issue however this is just a workaround. Modern browsers should work just fine with HW acceleration. The issue does not happen with Chrome or MS Edge so this is clearly something Firefox specific.

Is there a fix for it?
